malilibdev.hover.button.action_list_scre:
Create a Macro Action (or a "favorite actions list").
- Select one or more actions from the list on the left.
- You can hold Ctrl and/or Shift to select multiple entries.
- Macros are basically just action lists.
- Executing a macro runs all the actions on the list, in order.
- The action lists/macros can also be used in the Action Prompt screen to "pre-filter" the list of shown actions.
malilibdev.hover.button.action_widget_sc:
Export the settings for this screen to the system clipboard.

§eShift + left click§r to directly copy the settings without opening the text input screen to copy them from manually.

Import the settings for this screen from the system clipboard. §eCtrl + Shift + right click§r to directly apply the settings from the clipboard without opening the text input screen to input the settings string manually. §cWarning:§6 This will overwrite all the current settings and widgets on this screen!!
malilibdev.hover.button.config.config_st: Reset the name back to the original config name
malilibdev.hover.button.config.hotkey_se: Search hotkeys for the given keys
malilibdev.hover.button.config.reset_all: Reset all the configs matching the current search filters back to their default values
malilibdev.hover.button.config.text_fiel: Toggle between a text field and a slider
§6Using a slider is currently disabled for this config
malilibdev.hover.button.create_alias_for: Create an alias action, which is basically just a different (shorter/easier) name for the action. This is only useful if you want to run the action often via the Action Prompt by typing in the name to search for it.
malilibdev.hover.button.csi_edit.add_con: Add configs to this config status indicator widget/group
malilibdev.hover.button.custom_hotkeys.a: Add a new custom hotkey bound to one or more actions
malilibdev.hover.button.custom_hotkeys_m: Add, edit or remove custom hotkeys bound to actions
malilibdev.hover.button.custom_icons_men: Add or manage custom icon definitions
malilibdev.hover.button.directory_naviga: You can shift click the directory path elements to open the directory in the system file manager
malilibdev.hover.button.export_import_sc: Copy the string from the text field to the clipboard
Paste the contents of the clipboard to the text field

Read the settings from a file to the text field
(opens a file browser screen)

Write the settings from the text field to a file
(opens a file browser screen to select the file to save to)
malilibdev.hover.button.parameterize_act: Create a new copy of the action with the string argument already bound to a given value. This allows directly executing that action without having to input the string argument via the text input prompt screen.

Create a new copy of the action with the string argument already bound to a given value. This allows directly executing that action without having to input the string argument via the text input prompt screen.
<c=da0>Note: This button only adds the parameterized action to this macro, it does not get added to the registry and won't be available in the global list.
malilibdev.hover.button.plus_minus_tip:
- Left click to increase
- Right click to decrease
- Or scroll with the mouse over the button
- Shift and/or Alt to increase the step size
malilibdev.hover.button.re_parameterize_: Create a new parameterized copy of the action with the string argument bound to a new given value. This old version of the action will be removed and replaced with the newly created action with the given name and argument.
malilibdev.hover.button.render_layers.fo: If enabled, then the render layer follows the player
The next/previous layer hotkeys will affect this boundary. If both are unselected, then the hotkeys will affect the boundary that is closest to the player.
malilibdev.hover.action.action_types_exp:
- All: All actions currently in the registry
- Alias: User-added aliases (= renamed copies)
- Base: All mod-added "base" actions (= no user-added
  actions ie. aliases, macros or the bound paramaterized actions)
- Macro: User-created macros (= lists of actions)
- Parameterizable: Base actions that need a string argument
- Parameterized: User-added copies of parameterizable
  actions, where the argument is set already
- Simple: Non-parameterizable base actions
- User-added: All user-added actions
  (= aliases, macros and parameterized actions)
malilibdev.hover.action.add_action_execu:
Bind the argument to the action button directly.
If this is not set, then you will need to input the argument every time you run the action.
malilibdev.hover.action.command_deck.clo: Close the screen when an action is executed
Close the screen when all keys are released. §eNote: This will also execute the action that is being hovered!
malilibdev.hover.action.name: §8Name: §7%s
malilibdev.hover.action.prompt_screen.se: Also search against the display names of the actions, and not just against the "internal name"
malilibdev.hover.action.prompt_screen.us: Use "fuzzy search". In this mode all the characters from the search text must appear in the result in the correct order, but there can be other characters between them.
malilibdev.hover.config.open_quad_color_:
Open color editor
Current colors (AARRGGBB):
  Top: §f%s§r
  Bottom: §f%s§r
  Left: §f%s§r
  Right: §f%s§r
malilibdev.hover.config.search_default_s: You can change the default value that this drop down widget is set to in malilib configs, at Generic -> §eConfig Search Default Scope§r
malilibdev.hover.config_status_indicator: Use a different background color for odd rows
malilibdev.hover.custom_hotkey_edit_scre: Add the selected actions to the hotkey
malilibdev.hover.custom_hotkey_export_im:
- Append = add the actions from the import to the end of the current actions in the hotkey
- Overwrite = replace all the actions in the hotkey with the imported actions
malilibdev.hover.macro_action_export_imp:
- Append = add the actions from the imported macro to the end of the current actions in the macro
- Overwrite = replace all the actions in the macro with the imported actions
malilibdev.hover.macro_edit_screen.add_a: Add the selected actions to the macro
malilibdev.info.action.create_action_wid:
§eNote:§r The name can't be changed later!
§8(Except by renaming the corresponding save file manually.)§r

The name is only visible/used as the argument to the action to open the action screen. (And usually it would be set as the argument to the action in a parameterized action to be able to quickly/easily open the screen without typing in the name.)

The name should also be safe for a file name (it will also be automatically adjusted to be all lower case with underscores), as it will be the name of the file where the screen settings/configuration is saved.
malilibdev.info.action.create_parameteri: Create a copy of the action, with the argument bound to the given value. This allows directly executing the created action with that argument, without having to type it into the text input prompt window every time.
malilibdev.info.action.action_name_and_a:
<c=ff0>Note: You can't change the action name or argument later.</c>

The only way to "change" the name or argument (in-game) is to delete the action and create a new action with the new name.
malilibdev.info.action.action_name_immut:
<c=ff0>Note: You can't change the action name later.</c>

The only way to "change" the name (in-game) is to delete the action and create a new action with the new name.
malilibdev.info.custom_hotkey.name_immut:
<c=ff0>Note: You can't change the name later.</c>

The only way to "change" the name (in-game) is to delete the hotkey and create a new hotkey with the new name.
malilibdev.label.config.search.scope.all: From all categories in this mod
malilibdev.label.confirm.file_deletion: Are you sure you want to delete the selected §6%s§r file(s)?
malilibdev.label.confirm.selected_config: Are you sure you want to reset all the configs matching the current search filters back to their default values?
malilibdev.label.file_browser.rename.inf:
Provide a new name for the directory:
  <c=ee2>%s

Provide a new name for the file:
  §b%s
malilibdev.label.keybind_settings.tips:
- Left click to configure
- Right click to reset to defaults
malilibdev.label.message_debug.add_key_t: Add the translation key to the chat input field
malilibdev.label.message_redirect.add_re: Add a message redirect for the given translation key. You can easily see and copy the translation key for a given message by enabling the Debug -> '§eMessage Key To Chat§r' option in the malilib configs, and then causing the message to get shown.
malilibdev.label.misc.dropdown.type_to_s: Just start typing to search (in any DropDown widget)
malilibdev.title.screen.configs.config_s: MaLiLib %s - Config Status Indicator Widget Configuration
malilibdev.title.screen.create_action_wi: Create a new Action Widget Screen
malilibdev.title.screen.create_parameter: Create a Parameterized Copy of the Action
malilibdev.title.screen.edit_action_exec: Edit §b%s§r Action Execution Widgets At Once
malilibdev.title.screen.provide_argument: Provide the Argument(s) for the Action

Moved layer range §amax§r by §b%s§r on the §a%s§r axis

malilibdev.message.info.setting_string_c: Setting string from the text field copied to the clipboard
malilibdev.message.info.setting_string_p: Setting string pasted from the clipboard to the text field
malilibdev.message.info.settings_read_fr: Settings read from file and placed to the text field
malilibdev.config_group.comment.appearan: Various configs related to appearance/visuals and some config screen and other "appearance behavior"
malilibdev.config.comment.actionpromptfu:
Makes the Action Prompt search use a more lenient "fuzzy search".

That mode works such that all the characters from the search text must appear in the target string in that order, but there can be an arbitrary number or characters between them. So the search text can be kind of like an abbreviation of the target text.
malilibdev.config.comment.actionpromptre: Makes the search bar in the Action Prompt screen remember the search text from the last time the prompt was open
malilibdev.config.comment.actionpromptse: The search bar in the Action Prompt screen will also search against the display names of the actions, and not just against the action's internal name
malilibdev.config.comment.configbackupan:
The rotated config backups will be "anti-duplicated"

This means that if the to-be-created new config backup file is identical to an already existing older backup, then that older backup is moved as the latest backup, instead of creating a new backup.

Basically this prevents spamming new useless backups and overwriting older different backups if for example a single feature is toggled on and off often.

§8(The configs are saved to file any time the config menu is closed, and any configs have changed since last being saved. So for example toggling on or off a feature, and then opening and closing the config menu for that mod would cause the configs for that mod to get saved.)
malilibdev.config.comment.configbackupco:
This is the number of backup copies that will be kept of each of the mod config files.

A new backup is created whenever the config file is written to, which normally happens after some configs have been modified and the config screen is closed, or when logging out of the world.
malilibdev.config.comment.configwidgetba:
Enables a background color for the config option widgets on the config screens.

This is by default a slightly different color for odd and even rows.
malilibdev.config.comment.configsearchde: This is the default search scope in the config menu search bar, any time the config menu is (re-)opened
malilibdev.config.comment.customhotbarme:
This is the maximum number of concurrent messages that will be shown in the custom "action bar"/hot bar message renderer

That renderer is by default used to show the config option toggle messages etc.
malilibdev.config.comment.customscreensc:
Custom screen scale value for any screens using the malilib screen classes.

The recommended scale is usually 2, although it depends on your screen/game window resolution. The screens are designed for scale 2 in a 1280x720 window.

Use 0 for the default vanilla GUI scale value.
malilibdev.config.comment.datadumpcsvdel:
The column delimiter to use for CSV format data dumps

An example use case is Litematica's Material List, when written to file in the CSV format instead of the "ascii art table" format.
malilibdev.config.comment.defaulttogglem:
This is the default message output for any boolean config toggle messages, if the §eMessage Output§r option in the <c=eee>Advanced KeyBind Settings§r of the associated toggle hotkey is set to §3Default Toggle Output§r.

Basically this allows you to change the toggle message output for <c=eee>all boolean toggle hotkeys§r at once, as long as the §eMessage Output§r option for them is set to §3Default Toggle Output§r.
malilibdev.config.comment.dropdownsearch:
Should the DropDown widget search tip (about just starting to type to open the search) be shown.

Note that this automatically turns off when you type in a DropDown widget to open the search.
malilibdev.config.comment.filebrowsersho:
Should hidden files be shown by default in the file browser widgets.

The check for hidden files uses the Unix-type hidden files principle, so if the file name starts with a dot, it's considered to be a hidden file.

You can toggle this temporarily using the right click context menu in the file browser widgets-
malilibdev.config.comment.hideallcoordin:
This is a common option for other mods to use to hide all their coordinate outputs.

This is meant as a kind of "Streamer Mode" to protect your location.

§eNote/warning:§r It's up to the other mods using malilib to actually use and obey this option! This option doesn't/can't directly do anything on its own in malilib that would affect the other mods' coordinate output related features.
malilibdev.config.comment.hoveredlistent: The color for the hovered list entries on list screens
malilibdev.config.comment.hovertextmaxwi: The maximum width of the mouse over hover texts
malilibdev.config.comment.keybinddisplay: Shows a toast message for pressed keys and/or triggered hotkeys/actions

If enabled, then only keybinds that have a defined action callback will be displayed on the keybind display toast.

This prevents so called "modifier" keys from spamming the display, since they usually don't have a callback set, but instead something is just checking if the hotkey has been triggered and the key(s) are being held down.
If enabled, then only keybinds that are set to cancel further processing will be displayed on the keybind display toast.
The display duration (in milliseconds) for the keybind display toasts
malilibdev.config.comment.messagefadeout: The fade-out time (in milliseconds) for the main message renderer (which by default pops up on the center of the screen) messages when they expire. Use 0 for no fading.
malilibdev.config.comment.optionlistconf: Use a DropDown widget instead of a cycle button for OptionList type configs
malilibdev.config.comment.realmscommonco:
Whether or not to use a common config file name for all realms servers.

If this is disabled, then the server IP and port are used in the generated config file names. However, apparently the Realms server addresses change regularly, so the config names would change all the time and thus the configs wouldn't save properly. So basically leave this enabled if you only play on one Realms server. If you play on multiple Realms... then the configs will get mixed up regardless. Unless you play on the different servers on different Minecraft instances to keep the configs separated by the Minecraft instance.
malilibdev.config.comment.rememberconfig: Remember the config screen scrollbar position for each config tab/category
malilibdev.config.comment.rememberfilebr:
Remember the scroll position within each directory in the file browser widget

The position is remembered for as long as the screen is open (or rather for as long as the same file browser widget exists).
malilibdev.config.comment.selectedlisten: The border color for the currently selected list entries on any list screens
malilibdev.config.comment.servermessages: Allows server-side mods to send messages to the client via the malilib Message/Toast Renderers
malilibdev.config.comment.showinternalco: Show the internal config name below the localized display name of configs on the config screens
malilibdev.config.comment.sortconfigsbyn:
Force sorting all the config options in each config category by the display name.

Some mods may choose to use custom orders to group configs by their type, or otherwise use non-alphabetical order of configs in the category by default.

Also localized config names will likely be entirely different from the original English config names as for the proper alphabetical sorting order. This option makes the config category return the list of options sorted alphabetically based on the config display name. (I have no idea how the Java string sort handles non-latin/non-ascii characters though.)
malilibdev.config.comment.sortextensionm:
Sorts the configs shown on the config screens by the config display name.

This happens after any possible extension mod configs have been added to the end of the list of configs in the base mod. Note that this would also cause the base mod's configs to be sorted alphabetically, in case they weren't by default.

This option only takes effect if there actually are some options added by an extension mod. Also see the §eSort Configs By Name§r option which forces sorting the base mod configs in any case.
malilibdev.config.comment.debugmessages: Enables some debug messages to the game console
malilibdev.config.comment.guidebug:
When enabled, all GUI widgets will draw their outlines, and when hovered, also their position and dimension info and the widget class name.

If a key is set for Debug -> §eGUI Debug Key§r, then that key must be held for any of the debug rendering to happen.
malilibdev.config.comment.guidebugall:
Makes all widgets render their debug outline, instead of only the hovered widget.

This is only a sub-option for the behavior when the §eGUI Debug§r option is enabled.
malilibdev.config.comment.guidebuginfoal:
Makes the debug position and dimensions text always render, even when not hovering the widget.

§eNote: This usually looks very messy§r and generally isn't that useful.
malilibdev.config.comment.infooverlaydeb: Makes the Info Overlay widgets and InfoAreas render their debug outlines
malilibdev.config.comment.inputcanceldeb: Prints a debug message that includes the class name of the input handler that requested the cancellation of the input event
malilibdev.config.comment.keybinddebug:
Enables printing all key presses and held keys to the game console

If the §eKeyBind Debug In Action Bar§r and/or the §eKeyBind Debug Toast§r options are enabled, then the message also appears in those renderers.
malilibdev.config.comment.keybinddebugac: Makes the messages from §eKeyBind Debug§r also get sent to the "action bar" renderer
malilibdev.config.comment.keybinddebugto: Makes the messages from §eKeyBind Debug§r also get shown as toast messages
malilibdev.config.comment.messagekeytoch:
When enabled, any messages that are sent using a translation/localization key will print that translation key to the game chat.

This allows copying the translation key from chat if you want to add a message redirect/override for that message.

Message Redirects can be configured via the config menu that opens by running the §aopenMessageRedirectsListScreen§r action either via the §fAction Prompt Screen§r (opened via the Hotkeys -> §eOpen Action Prompt Screen§r hotkey) or the §fActions§r config menu.
malilibdev.config.comment.pressedkeystoa: Show the currently pressed/held keys as a toast message
malilibdev.config.comment.printstacktrac:
Enable printing the full stack trace to the console/log when certain errors happen.

By default only a shorter single line message is printed.

You may be asked to enable this while trobleshooting some bugs or issues with the mods, to get more verbose and more precise error messages.
malilibdev.config.comment.keybind_settin: Does the keybind activate on press, release or on both edges of triggering the key combination

Is an empty keybind valid.

If this is enabled, and the keybind combination is unbound, then the keybind will always be considered to be active.

Note that this is only meaningful for keys that are being checked to be held, i.e. so called "activation keys". Most hotkeys are "edge triggered" and have an associated callback that fires once when the key combination is completed. This will do nothing for such hotkeys.
Are extra keys (not part of the hotkey combination) allowed to be held to activate the keybind

Cancel further (vanilla) processing of the last pressed key, when the keybind activates.

§6Note§r: This only affects the last key in each hotkey combination, when the keybind is actually triggered.
Can the keybind be activated in-game, inside a GUI, or anywhere

If enabled, then no other keybinds can have been activated before this keybind.

This check resets when all held keys are released.

This can be used for things like Litematica's main menu key §6M§r, or MiniHUD's main rendering toggle §6H§r, while still having other key combinations that start with the same "main key" §6M§r. To do that, the "main key" §6M§r would be set to §3Exclusive§r, and to trigger on §3Release§r. Now if another key combination such as §6M + C§r triggers first, then when the §6M§r key is released, it won't trigger since another hotkey already triggered before it.

If enabled, then this keybind will only trigger if it's the first keybind to trigger with the key event that triggers it.

This is kind of similar to §3Exclusive§r, but it's per-pressed-key and does not need all keys to be released to trigger again.

Invert the "is the key held" state, so that the keybind will be considered active while it's §fnot§r being held.

Note that this is only meaningful for keys that are being checked to be held, i.e. so called "activation keys". Most hotkeys are "edge triggered" and have an associated callback that fires once when the key combination is completed. This will do nothing for such hotkeys.
The message output to use for a possible toggle message
Are the keys required to be pressed in the exact order they were defined in the keybind

The priority of this keybind in relation to other keybinds that trigger with the same key press (last key of this keybind combination).

This is a simple numerical sort order - lower values come first.

Should the toast message be shown for this hotkey.

This allows turning off the toast message for this hotkey entirely. This is useful for hotkeys that trigger often and would spam the toast renderer, such as the malilib scroll adjustment keys.

The toast message display in general must be enabled in malilib's configs, at Generic -> §eKeyBind Display§r. This is just a per-hotkey override to disable the message.

Makes this hotkey behave as a toggle, that changes it's state ON/OFF on each trigger event.

Note that this is only meaningful for keys that are being checked to be held, i.e. so called "activation keys". Most hotkeys are "edge triggered" and have an associated callback that fires once when the key combination is completed. This will do nothing for such hotkeys.
malilibdev.hotkey.comment.guidebugkey: The key that has to be held to render the GUI debug things like the widget outlines and position/size information etc. when the Debug -> §eGUI Debug§r option is enabled
malilibdev.hotkey.comment.ignoredkeys:
Any keys set here will be completely ignored from the malilib hotkey system.

This can be used to completely blacklist some keys from the malilib keybind system. This is meant for keys that cause issues or often get stuck for some reason. For example in my case if I use the mouse Back key while holding shift, then the mouse Forward key triggers and gets stuck on (as far as MinecraftClient and the LWJGL library see it).
malilibdev.hotkey.comment.openactionprom: Open the Action Prompt Screen for running actions by their name
malilibdev.hotkey.comment.scrollvalueadj:
The key to use for decreasing the value of "scroll-adjustable" configs

These usually work by holding down the toggle key for the feature in question, and then using this key to adjust the value (usually mouse wheel scrolling).

Also note that the scroll adjusting is enabled (for the handful of toggle hotkeys that have it in the first place) only when the §eActivate On§r setting is set to §3BOTH§r.

The key to use for increasing the value of "scroll-adjustable" configs

These usually work by holding down the toggle key for the feature in question, and then using this key to adjust the value (usually mouse wheel scrolling).

Also note that the scroll adjusting is enabled (for the handful of toggle hotkeys that have it in the first place) only when the §eActivate On§r setting is set to §3BOTH§r.

The key that needs to be held down for the "scroll adjusting" to be enabled.

By default this is set to §3NONE§r with §eAllow Empty Keybind§r enabled, that way you don't need to hold any extra keys in addition to the toggle keybind that the scroll adjusting is related to.

If you don't want scroll adjusting to happen "accidentally" while you are holding the toggle keybind and for example trying to scroll to change the selected hotbar slot, then you can set a key here (for example Shift) that you must additionally hold for the scroll adjusting to be enabled.

Also note that the scroll adjusting is enabled (for the handful of toggle hotkeys that have it in the first place) only when the §eActivate On§r setting is set to §3BOTH§r.
